abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Private Sector
            Development and Competitiveness Project for Democratic
            Republic Congo (DRC) is to support the Borrower's
            policy of the promotion of private-sector led growth
            through: (a) improving the investment climate; (b)
            supporting parastatal reform in the telecommunications,
            energy, finance, transport, and mining sectors; and (c)
            improving mining competitiveness in the Katanga region of
            the Borrower. This restructuring paper seeks your approval
            to proceed with the extension of the Project closing date by
            6 months, from December 31, 2012 to June 30, 2013. The 6
            month extension was approved in principle by Regional Vice
            President (RVP) on October 17, 2012, conditional upon
            fulfillment of prior actions which have now been satisfied,
            enabling the transfer of certain activities of high
            corporate reputation risk to other Bank projects for
            continuation and completion of their implementation. These
            include (i) an activity of the Management Action Plan (MAP)
            approved by the Board in May 2011 in response to an
            Inspection Panel request on behalf of ex-workers of the
            mining enterprise Gecamines who took part in a
            Project-supported labor retrenchment program in 2004-5, and
            (ii) a critical phase of the National Payments System (NPS)
            implementation at the Central Bank of Congo (BCC). The
            extension of closing date would allow the Project to make up
            for the time lost due to disruptions caused by election
            related political instability from mid-2011 to January 2012,
            including a period of one and a half months when the Country
            Office was closed and all staff evacuated. This is the
            second extension of the Project, pushing its cumulative
            extension to 39 months and age to 9 years and 11 months at closing.
